author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Anti-Gangster Squad of the Chennai City Police arrested three persons said to be part of the Chera gang, on Thursday.

Based on a tip-off, the squad undertook a surprise check in Pulianthope and arrested G. Karthi (32), S. Asaithambi (28) and R. Lokeshwaran (27). While Karthi and Asaithambi lived in B.V. Colony, Lokeshwaran was a resident of Ramana Nagar in Perambur. The police officials have seized knives from them. A senior police official said Karthi had several cases in connection with murder, possession of deadly weapons and attempt to murder against him at the M.K.B. Nagar police station. Known to belong to Chera gang, he had already been arrested under Goondas Act four times. Similarly, Asaithambi had 15 criminal cases pending against him. The accused were handed over to police officials at M.K.B. Nagar. — Staff Reporter
title: Gangsters arrested
